name: Caro Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Caro Hotel from Nov 6 - Nov 9. We absolutely LOVE the hotel!
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever!!!

reviews.text: First of all, all the staff are very helpful, professional and polite. They really make you feel welcome. Secondly, the location is just excellent! It is in the heart of the old town and within a short walk to Plaza de la Reina. You can take the No.1 or No. 95 lines at a bus stop near the hotel (a short 2 blocks away) to the famous City of Arts and Science - Ciudad de las Artes y las Ciencias.
reviews.title: Excellent boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the room itself, we stayed at Room 27 and it was just perfect! We love the modern style and the minimalist feel. The room was very clean and quiet; and the bed was very comfortable! They actually let you choose different kinds of pillows at the front desk but the ones in the room were just perfect for us, so we didn't try the other ones. We had no problem with the water pressure or the water temperature, they were just right! The wifi was very fast too! Oh, how can you not love the Bvlgari amenities they provide? It was just so fancy and luxurious! Also, the room has a very pleasant fragrant and we think it's from the soap. We can't really figure it out, so if you know what makes it smells so nice, please let us know =)
reviews.title: Lovely hotel
A unique "new" hotel
reviews.text: In addition, Caro Hotel offers complimentary mini bar, yes, IT IS FREE and they refill it everyday! There's soda, mineral water, juice, olives, chips, chocolate, etc. You also get a welcome drink at the hotel bar upon arrival.

Caro is perfect for couples but if you are traveling with your friends, please note that the bathroom is semi-open, so privacy may be an issue. Also, it is a bit dark near the door which is where the thermostat is located. If you need to adjust the room temperature, you will need to use your phone as a light source so you can see the screen.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My booking (with booking.com) promised a room with a scenic view. The view in fact was simply of another building very close by. Not too bothered about the lack of view, I thought it would at least be quiet. How wrong could I be! After going to bed just after midnight I was kept awake for an hour and a half by loud voices outside. I assumed this to be associated with the building opposite. Worse still was the smell of smoke penetrating the room even though all the windows were shut. I could even smell the smoke in bed.
reviews.title: Noise and cigarette smoke

reviews.text: When I got up in the morning and investigated in the daylight, I found that the noise and smoke were not associated with the the building opposite at all but had come from the hotel's smoking area right underneath my windows!
reviews.title: A Good Choice in Valencia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel receptionist was very helpful and organised a move to a better room for the remaining two nights (which is why I am putting this hotel in the "poor" category rather than "terrible") but I absolutely cannot understand how the hotel can allow such a thing to occur in the first place. The hotel management must know that the smoking area is directly below the windows of one their rooms.
reviews.title: Terrific

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Furthermore, at every other hotel I have stayed at in Spain, I have been asked on checkout whether I wanted to pay in Euros or in GB pounds. I always pay in Euros to avoid the bad exchange rates given by the hotels. At the Caro hotel I was presented with a bill in Euros and was not asked how I wanted to pay, so naturally I assumed I was going to be paying in Euros. Not so. Only after paying did it become clear that the hotel had charged me in GB pounds, with a considerable mark-up on the exchange rate.
reviews.title: Can't fault it - lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In Valencia one has the option of staying in the "new city" or the "old town". I elected to stay in the old town as a means of better experiencing the history and culture of the city. The Caro is not only in the ancient old town but it is in fact a very well re-furbished old palace. The restorers have done an excellent job of transforming a very old building into a high-tech modern hotel. Further, the location is outstanding with all the atmospheric attractions of the old town (central market, cathedral, plazas, silk exchange etc.) within easy walking distance. The staff was very helpful in guiding me to the use of a local bus to reach the City of Arts and Sciences---Valencia's principal tourist attraction. Travellers to Valencia should seriously consider the Caro which provided modern amenities in a classic setting.
reviews.title: What a Great Little Hotel is Hotel Caro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic hotel. Right in the centre of Valencia, we booked into the hotel, had our car parked for us and began a fantastic stay. Walked a few hundred metres to the Cathedral and ate tapas as we watched people enjoying the sights. Plenty to watch, eat and drink. Returned to our hotel and our room that had so many historical features that were revealed to us by a member of staff. In the morning we enjoyed a lovely breakfast as our car was brought to the front of the hotel. During our road trip we enjoyed many wonderful hotels but this was the best. Stylish, characterful, friendly, central and full of charm. We will return as it is a gem in a wonderful city. Excellent staff. If you are visiting Valencia visit the Caro hotel.
reviews.title: Spanish road trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second stay at the Caro Hotel in Valencia... and unfortunately it will be our last!
reviews.title: Caro Hotel... you blew it, BIG TIME!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I begin...?
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps with the fact that my partner and I live just 3 hours from Valencia, in a small village of Catalunya named Sitges. We decided to drive to Valencia to celebrate our anniversary. We thought it would be a great idea to book an amazing hotel, have an amazing dinner, and just enjoy a beautiful city during this festive season!
reviews.title: Super Place All Round!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a lot of time comparing the available 4 & 5 star hotels in the area. All were generally around the same price... but since we were familiar with the Caro Hotel, we decided to make a return visit. We booked a Superior room category with breakfast.
reviews.title: Amazing!!

reviews.text: I stayed here on a recent holiday to Valenica. The hotel is very small and clean and has a good minilamist decor. It also boasts history having being a palace previously. It has relics of this throughout the hotel which is good. It is also very well centrally located and walking distance to most sites which is key for me. The disadvantages are that many rooms abut a school which is very noisy and I had to change my room. The staff are very friendly and helpful. My only concern is that it can feel overfamiliar as you see the same faces you have to walk past daily which almost feels like you are being watched. Not quite sure if I shall stay here again though it was very good as a first visit
reviews.title: civilised boutique hotel which needs atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: that was our first stay in the Caro. We are living in Spain and stayed few times in Valencia deferent hotels. Caro is a nice boutique hotel just few minutes walk to the Cathedral. Its not easy to find it, but easy to remember..:) Valencia is amazing - history and modern are connected in amazing way. Caro is the best example. The design of the Hotel - is fantastic. every detail is important. I think next time we will ask another room, as our was quiet small. But that didn't spoil our stay.Bar area - beautiful. Its very clean place. The staff is very professional and friendly ( one of the best in Valencia).
reviews.title: Modern Hotel in the city centre

reviews.text: This small boutique hotel that is located in the heart of the old part of this beautiful city is a surprising find. It was originally a small "palacete" belonging to a prestigious Valencia family before it was turned into this lovely boutique hotel. It took them 7 years to finish the work as they kept discovering amazing archeological treasures during the construction period. Some of the discovered pieces are on display throughout the hotel and these add a certain touch of beauty and mystery to the very modern and design look of the hotel. The professionalism coupled with the warm smiles of the staff added to make my stay an extremely pleasant one.
reviews.title: A small gem in the heart of old Valencia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited the hotel in mid-December 2012 for a week. On the whole the hotel was excellent and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is a bonus as it is close to the Cathedral which allowed us to explore a lot of the city on foot. Our rating would have been 5 had it not been for a couple of small issues; firstly if the nearby building work is still going on don't get a room near the front - too noisy. Secondly there was a Christmas party that went on too late for a decent night's sleep following a long day on foot. Don't let this put you off though, it is just worth checking what's happening on the day to align your plans. Finally if the high price of breakfast puts you off taking this in the hotel (though the hotel chef is v.good, worth trying to book an evening meal while you're there) then walk towards the cathedral and before the large square there a couple of bars/cafes which are definitely worth trying (v. friendly and good service).
reviews.title: December holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I needed a break and decided to book a last minute at Caro Hotel in Valencia.
reviews.title: Romantic evening

description: Ornamental elements of almost 2,000 years old, wooden beams from the eighteenth century, bright rooms with skylights, the 800-years-old Arabic wall of Valencia behind the bedhead, the former ballroom of the nineteenth-century palace, surprising concrete ceilings...Caro Hotel makes a unique range of 26 rooms available to the guest. Every room is different from each other, just in the heart of Valencia. Would you like to discover which one is yours?
